title: This Is When Your Xiaomi Phone Will Get The HyperOS 2 Update
description: Is your Xiaomi handset getting the HyperOS 2 update?
author: Peter Holden
excerpt: Is your Xiaomi handset getting the HyperOS 2 update?
text: Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more. With smartphones beginning to launch running Android 15, phones purchased in 2024 are likely still running on Android 14. Thankfully, the rollout of this latest version of Android is happening quicker than ever before, with release schedules posted by the likes of Xiaomi to advise on when its HyperOS 2 update will be available and to which devices. Join us after the break to find out when your Xiaomi handset or tablet will get updated to HyperOS 2/Android 15. Thanks to Xiaomi's founder and CEO, Lei Jun, we have the full release schedule for when HyperOS 2 will begin rolling out to global handsets and tablets. Besides Xiaomi, the post also covers Poco and Redmi devices. Image: Xiaomi Release Schedule For November: Phones Xiaomi Mix Flip Xiaomi 14T Xiaomi 14T Pro Xiaomi 14T Ultra Xiaomi 14 Xiaomi 13T Pro Poco F6 Pro Poco X6 Poco X6 Pro Poco M6 Pro Redmi Note 13 Pro+ 5G Redmi Note 13 Pro 5G Redmi Note 13 Pro Redmi Note 13 5G Redmi Note 13 Tablets Xiaomi Pad 6S Pro 12.4 Wearables Xiaomi Smart Band 9 Pro Release Schedule For December: Phones Xiaomi 13 Ultra Xiaomi 13 Pro Xiaomi 13 Xiaomi 13T Xiaomi 13 Lite Xiaomi 12T Pro Xiaomi 12T Xiaomi 12 Pro Xiaomi 12 Mi 11 Ultra Mi 11 Xiaomi 11 Lite 5G NE Poco F6 Poco M6 Poco F5 Pro Poco C75 Poco C65 Poco X5 Pro 5G Poco X5 Poco X4 GT Poco F4 GT Redmi K50i Redmi 13 Redmi 13C Redmi 13C 5G Redmi Note 12 Pro+ 5G Redmi Note 12 Pro 5G Redmi Note 12 Redmi Note 12 5G Redmi Note 12S Redmi 12 5G Redmi 12 Tablets Xiaomi Pad 6 Poco Pad Redmi Pad Pro 5G Redmi Pad Pro Redmi Pad SE 8.7 4G Redmi Pad SE 8.7 Redmi Pad SE Based on Android 15, HyperOS 2 will bring a host of AI enhancements to these phones, tablets, and wearables. Called HyperAI, it incorporates features such as AI-powered lock screens, AI Anti-Fraud protection, and integration with Mi Canvas on tablets. HyperOS 2 also features a redesigned desktop with customizable widgets and a refreshed layout. It also offers additional personalization, security, performance, and productivity enhancements. Image: Xiaomi The schedule follows the recent release of the Xiaomi 15 series in China. It is powered by Qualcomm's new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset and is set to compete with the OnePlus 13 and Oppo's Dimensity 9400-powered Find X8 Pro. Hopefully, your Xiaomi phone is mentioned in the release schedule, but if it isn't, there's always a chance that more devices will be added once the first tranches of updates have rolled out. If not, it may be time to look at upgrading your handset to gain access to the new features, cameras, and security improvements. Let us know in the comments below if your phone is included in the list, and if it is, keep an eye out for the update rolling out. He's been an Android fan ever since owning an HTC Hero, with the Dell Streak being his first phablet. He currently carries an Honor Magic 5 Pro in his pockets, a Xiaomi Pad 5 in his backpack, and thinks nothing of lugging a 17-inch laptop around the world. When not immersed in the world of Android and gadgets, he's an avid sports fan, and like all South Africans, he loves a good Braai (BBQ). Previous Post
html:
Editorial Note: Talk Android may contain affiliate links on some articles. If you make a purchase through these links, we will earn a commission at no extra cost to you. Learn more.

With smartphones beginning to launch running Android 15, phones purchased in 2024 are likely still running on Android 14. Thankfully, the rollout of this latest version of Android is happening quicker than ever before, with release schedules posted by the likes of Xiaomi to advise on when its HyperOS 2 update will be available and to which devices.

Join us after the break to find out when your Xiaomi handset or tablet will get updated to HyperOS 2/Android 15.

Thanks to Xiaomi's founder and CEO, Lei Jun, we have the full release schedule for when HyperOS 2 will begin rolling out to global handsets and tablets. Besides Xiaomi, the post also covers Poco and Redmi devices.

Release Schedule For November:

Phones

  • Xiaomi Mix Flip
  • Xiaomi 14T
  • Xiaomi 14T Pro
  • Xiaomi 14T Ultra
  • Xiaomi 14
  • Xiaomi 13T Pro
  • Poco F6 Pro
  • Poco X6
  • Poco X6 Pro
  • Poco M6 Pro
  • Redmi Note 13 Pro+ 5G
  • Redmi Note 13 Pro 5G
  • Redmi Note 13 Pro
  • Redmi Note 13 5G
  • Redmi Note 13

Tablets

  • Xiaomi Pad 6S Pro 12.4

Wearables

  • Xiaomi Smart Band 9 Pro

Release Schedule For December:

Phones

  • Xiaomi 13 Ultra
  • Xiaomi 13 Pro
  • Xiaomi 13
  • Xiaomi 13T
  • Xiaomi 13 Lite
  • Xiaomi 12T Pro
  • Xiaomi 12T
  • Xiaomi 12 Pro
  • Xiaomi 12
  • Mi 11 Ultra
  • Mi 11
  • Xiaomi 11 Lite 5G NE
  • Poco F6
  • Poco M6
  • Poco F5 Pro
  • Poco C75
  • Poco C65
  • Poco X5 Pro 5G
  • Poco X5
  • Poco X4 GT
  • Poco F4 GT
  • Redmi K50i
  • Redmi 13
  • Redmi 13C
  • Redmi 13C 5G
  • Redmi Note 12 Pro+ 5G
  • Redmi Note 12 Pro 5G
  • Redmi Note 12
  • Redmi Note 12 5G
  • Redmi Note 12S
  • Redmi 12 5G
  • Redmi 12

Tablets

  • Xiaomi Pad 6
  • Poco Pad
  • Redmi Pad Pro 5G
  • Redmi Pad Pro
  • Redmi Pad SE 8.7 4G
  • Redmi Pad SE 8.7
  • Redmi Pad SE

Based on Android 15, HyperOS 2 will bring a host of AI enhancements to these phones, tablets, and wearables. Called HyperAI, it incorporates features such as AI-powered lock screens, AI Anti-Fraud protection, and integration with Mi Canvas on tablets.

HyperOS 2 also features a redesigned desktop with customizable widgets and a refreshed layout. It also offers additional personalization, security, performance, and productivity enhancements.

The schedule follows the recent release of the Xiaomi 15 series in China. It is powered by Qualcomm's new Snapdragon 8 Elite chipset and is set to compete with the OnePlus 13 and Oppo's Dimensity 9400-powered Find X8 Pro.

Hopefully, your Xiaomi phone is mentioned in the release schedule, but if it isn't, there's always a chance that more devices will be added once the first tranches of updates have rolled out. If not, it may be time to look at upgrading your handset to gain access to the new features, cameras, and security improvements.

Let us know in the comments below if your phone is included in the list, and if it is, keep an eye out for the update rolling out.

He's been an Android fan ever since owning an HTC Hero, with the Dell Streak being his first phablet. He currently carries an Honor Magic 5 Pro in his pockets, a Xiaomi Pad 5 in his backpack, and thinks nothing of lugging a 17-inch laptop around the world. When not immersed in the world of Android and gadgets, he's an avid sports fan, and like all South Africans, he loves a good Braai (BBQ).
